issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: Fix non-empty dir warning message when setting default EC policy

Hi [~hanishakoneru]

I have thought about it.

But, when the user has not specified the policy during set policy, to tell the user, we are setting default Policy, I have done in this way. So, we can specify in the message it is the default.

Otherwise, we will be changing the message printed to the user in default/and user-specified cas the to same message.

Thanks [~bharatviswa]. Got it now.

Can we have some boolean {{isDefault}} or something instead of {{ecName}}. The two variables {{ecName}} and {{ecPolicyName}} are confusing :).

[~hanishakoneru] Thanks for the review.

Addressed review comment in patch v01.

Thanks [~bharatviswa].

+1 for patch v01 pending Jenkins.

Thanks [~hanishakoneru] for reporting the issue and [~bharatviswa] for fixing it.

I don't think the fix is correct though. The configuration is a NN property, so even though we can read it in ECAdmin, there is no way we can guarantee its value is the same as the NN.

Instead of printing out the default policy name, how about we just literally say 'the default erasure coding policy' in the message?

| (x) *{color:red}-1 overall{color}* |

As the property name suggests, that is an NN configuration. Reading it at the client side and setting it explicitly is an incompatible change. 
We should keep the original behavior of passing null to let NN choose the default policy, and make this jira a message improvement, as it originally suggested.

Yes, [~xiaochen]  patch proposed solution will be an incompatible change.

Okay, I will go with message improvement. Thanks for the discussion.

[~xiaochen]

Updated patch v02, to address as you suggested.

Thanks for revving [~bharatviswa].

A minor comment:
In patch 2, we check {{ecPolicyName == null}} 2 times, once before list status and once after, both for printing the default name.
Can we just do 1 check after {{setEracureCodingPolicy}}, then if it's null, (and because it's not used afterwards) set it to the string {{default erasure coding policy}}? This way, we can just do 1 println for each message, without the need for if-else blocks. We may need to change the 'Set xxx' message a little bit to make sense of the sentence, which I think should be fine.

[~xiaochen]
